div.head: To my friend Mr. IOHN SPEED, being very sicke.

lg.l: Great loue, and little skill may cause me to missay.
But certainly this sicknes cannot make thee die:
Though cruell symptomes, and these thirteene yeeres assay
For thy deare country, doth thy health & strength decay.
Yet sith thy toylsome labour, and thy industrie.
Is for thy Countries sake, her fame on hie to raise:
Shee shall thy temples crowne with euerlasting bayes,
And in despite of death, shall cause thy memorie
To liue in endles fame with all posteritie.
Now may shee see her beauty, and her riches store,
What erst shee was in eu'rie age, and change of state,
And present greatnes such as neuer heretofore,
Since this great Monarch rul'd from North to southerne shore,
And sith thy life is to thy country dedicate,
Let none presume thy lawrell from thy bead to reaue
For this hir story, which thy skilfull hand did weaue:
But liue, & wearest [Speed] vntil the worlds great fate
Shall bring all earthly things vnto their vtmost date.
